articles.author: SERKAN GURBUZ and JEFFREY COLLINS
articles.description: BALTIMORE (AP) — Teams of engineers are working Saturday on the intricate process of cutting and lifting the first section of twisted steel from the collapsed Francis Scott Key Bridge in Maryland,
articles.title: Crews carefully start removing first piece of twisted steel from collapsed Baltimore bridge

articles.author: DAVID A. LIEB, MICHAEL CASEY, JEFF MCMURRAY and CHRISTOPHER KELLER
articles.description: After a yearlong closure, a bridge over the Puyallup River reopened in 2019 with a sturdy new span and a brand new name. It even won a national award.But today, the Fishing Wars Memorial Bridge is closed again after federal officials raised concerns about a vintage section of the nearly century-old bridge that carried about 15,000 vehicles a day.
articles.title: The Baltimore collapse focused attention on vital bridges. Thousands are in poor shape across the US

articles.author: HANNAH FINGERHUT
articles.description: DES MOINES, Iowa (AP) — Lawmakers in more than a dozen states have proposed legislation to allow spiritual chaplains in public schools, a move that proponents say will ease a youth mental health crisis, bolster staff retention and offer spiritual care to students who can’t afford or access religious schools.
articles.title: Some state lawmakers want school chaplains as part of a 'rescue mission' for public education

articles.author: NICOLE WINFIELD
articles.description: ROME (AP) — Pope Francis presided over the Vatican's somber Easter Vigil service on Saturday night, delivering a 10-minute homily and baptizing eight people, a day after suddenly skipping the Good Friday procession at the Colosseum as a health precaution.
articles.title: Pope presides over Easter Vigil, delivers 10-minute homily after skipping Good Friday at last minute

articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — A three-ship convoy left a port in Cyprus on Saturday with 400 tons of food and other supplies for Gaza as concerns about hunger in the territory soar.
articles.title: Ships with a second round of aid for Gaza have departed Cyprus as concerns about hunger soar

articles.author: JULIA FRANKEL
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Israel's Supreme Court ruling curtailing subsidies for ultra-Orthodox men has rattled Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's governing coalition and raised questions about its viability as the country presses on with the war in Gaza.
articles.title: Israel's high court says the government must stop funding seminaries. Could that topple Netanyahu?

articles.author: SEUNG MIN KIM and BRIAN SLODYSKO
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden’s reelection campaign is raising gobs of cash.
articles.title: President Joe Biden is lapping Donald Trump when it comes to campaign cash — and he'll need it

articles.author: LISA MASCARO
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — As Donald Trump campaigns on promises of mass deportations and pardons for those convicted in the Jan.
articles.title: Some of Trump's allies in Congress already support his 2025 ideas on deportations and Jan. 6 pardons

articles.author: SUSAN MONTOYA BRYAN
articles.description: The largest uranium producer in the United States is ramping up work just south of Grand Canyon National Park on a long-contested project that largely has sat dormant since the 1980s. The work is unfolding as global instability and growing demand drive uranium prices higher.
articles.title: Uranium is being mined near the Grand Canyon as prices soar and the US pushes for more nuclear power

articles.author: LUIS ANDRES HENAO
articles.description: MATANZAS, Cuba (AP) — Proudly wearing a rainbow-colored clergy stole and a rainbow flag in her clerical collar, the Rev. Elaine Saralegui welcomed all to her LGBTQ+ inclusive church in the Cuban port city of Matanzas.
articles.title: LGBTQ-inclusive church in Cuba welcomes all in a country that once sent gay people to labor camps
